comments.content: NVM. Changing my answer to "C". Sorry for the confusion.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Cortex XDR Vendor Agnostic Pro: This license is designed to handle logs from various vendors, suggesting that it supports ingestion of diverse external logs.

Cortex XDR Pro per TB: This license is based on the volume of data (per terabyte), which is suitable for high volumes of log data but may not specifically address the vendor-agnostic nature.

If the key factor is the volume of data rather than the specific sources of the logs, Cortex XDR Pro per TB would indeed be a better choice, but the question is clear: "for ingesting external logs from VARIOUS VENDORS".

I will go for "B" on this.

Selected Answer: C
LICENSE TYPE:
Ingesting Logs and Data from external sources requires a Cortex XDR Pro per GB license.
To receive Syslog data from an external source, you must fi rst set up the Syslog Collector applet on a Broker VM within your network.

From CXPAG: Ingesting logs and data requires a Cortex XDR Pro per GB license.

They have now changed the name of the license to "Pro per GB license" instead of TB.

questions.question_text: What license would be required for ingesting external logs from various vendors?

choices.D: Alerts Table > Right-click on an alert > Remediation Suggestions
choices.A: Alerts Table > Right-click on a process node > Remediation Suggestions

discussion.content: B and C are correct actually

Selected Answer: B
Steps to navigate remediation suggestions: Step 1: Initiate a remediation analysis. You caninitiate a remediation suggestions analysis from either of the following places: ● IntheIncident View, navigate to Actions > Remediation Suggestions.
But C is also a Correct one. :D Either through Causality and Incidents, you can perform Remediation Suggestions
